oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Thomas Hospital, Nashville, Tenn., between 1930 and 1945
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of St. Thomas Hospital located on Hayes Street at the corner of Twentieth Avenue. This hospital was established by Bishop Thomas S. Byrne, and run by the Sisters of Charity under the Roman Catholic Church. In 1974, St. Thomas opened a new building on Harding Road. The newest wing of the facility is now used by Baptist Hospital, while the rest of the structure was torn down for a parking lot. Forms part of the Norton Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Saint Thomas Hospital (Nashville, Tenn.)
